articles.title: Ingenuity Mars helicopter completes first one-way trip - Phys.org
articles.description: NASA's Ingenuity Mars Helicopter completed its fifth flight on the Red Planet today with its first one-way journey from Wright Brothers Field to an airfield 423 feet (129 meters) to the south. After arrival above its new airfield, Ingenuity climbed to an alti…

articles.author: Sean Martin
articles.title: Sunspot twice as wide as Earth could 'fire eruptions' straight at us 'It's a big one' - Daily Express
articles.description: A SUNSPOT has emerged on the surface of the Sun and astronomers have warned it is a 'big one' which could fire 'eruptions' straight at Earth.

articles.author: Vishwam Sankaran
articles.title: Some volcanoes on Mars may still be active, giving warmth to potential sub-surface life, scientists say - The Independent
articles.description: Data from satellites orbitting Mars indicates eruptions could have taken place much more recently than previously known
articles.content:
The Martian sub-surface could be warm enough in places to support life, according to a new study.
Using data from satellites orbitting Mars, scientists found evidence of recent volcanic activity on … [+3093 chars]

articles.author: Mindy Weisberger
articles.title: Tiny dinosaur that looked like an owl hunted like one, too - Livescience.com
articles.description: Like many owls, it was probably a nighttime predator.
articles.content:
A tiny, meat-eating dinosaur
 had superb low-light vision and hearing that was likely as good as an owl's. And like an owl, the wee dinosaur probably used those exceptional abilities to stalk and ca… [+5527 chars]

articles.author: Sebastian Kettley
articles.title: Scientists unveil ingenious machine to refreeze the North Pole and fight climate change - Daily Express
articles.description: SCIENTISTS from the University of Bangor have unveiled a radical plan to fight climate change by refreezing the North Pole. How will they do it? By harnessing the power of the wind and a bit of human ingenuity.

articles.author: Oliver Trapnell
articles.title: German scientist predicted man named 'Elon' would lead humanity to Mars in 1953 book - Daily Express
articles.description: A SCIENTIST predicted 70 years ago that a man named ‘Elon' would lead humanity to Mars.

articles.author: Sebastian Kettley
articles.title: Yellowstone volcano hit by 43 earthquakes amid fears supervolcano is overdue an eruption - Daily Express
articles.description: YELLOWSTONE volcano was struck by more than 40 earthquakes in April, amid widespread concern the US supervolcano is going to blow one day without warning. But is the Yellowstone volcano overdue for an eruption and should you be worried?
